result.execSummary:
The defendant Erica A. Burdick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erica A. Burdick

defendant.name: Burdick, Erica A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  State states agreement.  Atty Dolch is in agreement.  VIS provided and reviewed.  Court sentences.

Ct 1:
$443.00 costs/DNA surcharge and $200.00 surcharge for GPS and $164.50 filing fee to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and intern Cody McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Officer Mike Pichler - BPD - alsoappears.  8:34 am.  DE amended motion in limine.  Parties have agreed upon.  All witnesses sequestered.  3 witnesses total.  On the record at 9:09 a.m.  Court goes over final questions for the parties as to the jury draw.  All potential jurors in at 9:14 a.m.  Court reads instructions to the potential jurors.  All potential jurors sworn and first 18 jurors called.  Court does voir dire.  Court excuses #18.  Clerk calls #19.  Intern McConnell does voir dire.  Court excuses #6.  Clerk calls #20.  McConnell continues voir dire.  Atty Dolch does voir dire.  Parties do strikes.  Court introduces the rest of the courtroom staff to the jurors while parties do strikes.  Clerk calls final 12 jurors and remaining jurors are excused.  All 12 jurors are sworn.  Court reads final instructions to jury.  Court thanks all potential jurors in the courtroom for coming.  Recess at 10:08 a.m.  Back on the record at 10:31 a.m.  Jury in at 10:32 a.m.  Intern McConnell does opening statement.  Atty Dolch does opening statement.  State calls Off. Michael Pichler - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Intern McConnell continues direct.  Exhibit #1 marked and ID'd.  Court receives exhibit #1.  Intern McConnell continues direct.  Atty Dolch does cross-exam.  Exhibit #2 marked and ID'd.  Witness excused.  State calls M.R. - S&T.  Atty Dolch does cross-exam.  Exhibit #3 marked and ID'd.  State does re-direct.  Witness excused.  No further witnesses from the State.  Atty Dolch calls DE - S&T.  State does cross-exam.  No further testimony.  Jury out at 11:18 a.m.  Back on the record at 12:18 pm.  Court reviews jury instructions w/parties.  Off the record again at 12:30 pm.  Back on the record at 1:00 pm.  Jury in - Court reads instructions to the jury.  State gives closing argument.  Atty Dolch gives closing argument.  State gives response argument.  Court reads final instructions.  Bailiff sworn and jury out at 1:34 pm.  Parties in agreement that instructions were read correctly and Court is in recess at 1:36 pm.  Back on the record at 2:01 pm.  Bailiff has informed the Court that the jury has a verdict.  Jury back in at 2:03 pm.  Foreperson advises Court that they have reached a verdict.  Forms provided to the Court.  Court reads the verdict - as to Count 1 the jury finds the DE Guilty.  State requests the jury be polled.  Court polls the jury and all parties agree w/the verdict as read.  Court thanks the jury for their service and gives final instructions to jurors.  Jury excused at 2:06 pm.  Atty Dolch requests sentencing hearing be set.  Court enters judgment of conviction based on the jury's verdict.  Bond continued pending sentencing.

Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dolch states matter is not resolved and they are prepared to go to JT.  Bond continued.

Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Middleton stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea- Set for Trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PTC done w/Atty. Calkins.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.  Bond continues.
for leave to file additional motions

Return date at 05-27-2015 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference at 05-15-2015 08:45 am.

Defendant Erica A. Burdick in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. Advised rights to an attorney, waived today only.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.   No contact w/victim M.R.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
